Hey there, guys and gals.

Wanted to pop in and give an update on this situation. I have looked into it, and, while the thread in question did have a comment chain that violated board rules and a title that was a bit too politically charged for the boards environment, I think there's a middle ground that can solve these issues and allow for the thread's restoration.

**I will be reversing the deletion**, but I will be removing the problematic comment chain and also editing the title of the post, which does mock a fairly controversial socio-political topic and, as such, is not really something we want around. Normally we do *not* do this sort of content edit, so this is an exception to our usual policy in this particular instance -- **future instances will likely end up removed, with the OP encouraged to repost the thread without the offending title. I'll make sure the team knows to include this clarifying line in future removals as well, as I notice it was not included here.**

I'd be interested in hearing the community's input on this policy as well -- we're open to discuss changing this rule if the community would rather moderation do content edits on threads that have rule-breaking elements but have been left up long enough to get actual discussion going.

**Edit:** The post has been restored. You can find it [here](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/Ex25cfJj). OP, please let me know if you'd like me to change the new title to a different one of your choosing.

My pleasure! Glad we have a resolution you're okay with. 

In the future you're always welcome to come to the Discord or, if you feel it needs escalation, ping a Herald. I'm usually around within a few hours, and the other Heralds will also be happy to assist when they're available.

That said, while I do understand your frustration and your perspective, the accusations of insanity are not the most helpful to efficient resolution. Our moderation team does make mistakes (or, in this case, discretionary decisions that, while not incorrect by our official policies, could have been resolved in a better fashion), and having a friendly discussion tends to be my preferred method of reaching a resolution faster and with less conflict on both sides. It makes it easier for everyone to approach the problem with the other side's good intentions in mind -- something I think caused some miscommunication in this thread, and something we as a moderation team will try to do better on in the future. <3

> I dont have any problem with the new title.

Perfect! I actually spent a little while trying to pick the right slightly meme-y replacement, and I'm happy to hear it appeals. Best of luck with the thread!

Given that we've come to a complete resolution of the issue thanks to The Djinn, I'm going to take steps to clean up this thread now. Disagreement with us is okay, but when the conversation devolves into bringing insults to people, that's where the conversation becomes less viable. Further, insulting anyone on the Boards is against the [Universal Rules](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/ITFIpNUE), which are also in full effect here.

Djinn's post is still the top pinned response for a reason, I'm simply replying to his comment so that visibility and transparency of the decision is available simultaneously.

If you find yourself getting a notification from me, it will be because I've gone through and cleaned up the thread.

If you have questions, feel free to talk to us in the The [Boards Moderation Discord](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/qVlculPP-boards-moderation-discord) or the [Discuss the Boards](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation) sub-board.

You're welcome, although I'd personally appreciate it if we could back off the rest of the team. Everyone tries their best and was chosen due to their dedication to making the boards a better place, but some people have more experience than others, some people are better at communicating their reasoning in a community-facing way than others, and none of us -- myself included -- will ever be beyond improvement. In short, give us stuff we can work with and we'll try our best to make improvements in those areas, but critique like this doesn't help our team improve in ways that make the boards a better place.
